sections.how_to_use: Microwave for 60 seconds and it is ready as regular pasta
sections.nutrition: 9% of sodium, 42g of protein of Carbohydrate, 8% of Dietary Fiber

recipes.name: Ready Pasta (Elbows) Cobb Salad
ingredients: 2 slices bacon, crispy and cut in strips
preparation: Tear corner of Ready Pasta pouch to vent, heat in microwave for one minute.
Pour on a plate and let cool down.
Toss pasta with all ingredients together in individual-sized serving bowls.
recipes.tips: For a vegan/vegetarian alternative, replace meat with non-meat protein alternatives (chickpeas, black beans, soy “meat,” tempeh)

recipes.name: Super Quick Elbows with Tomato Basil Sauce and Cheese
ingredients: 1 cup of Barilla Tomato & Basil Sauce
preparation: Tear corner of Ready Pasta pouch to vent, heat for 60 seconds in the microwave.
Warm sauce and basil in a bowl for 2 minutes in the microwave.
Combine pasta with sauce and top with cheese.

sections.how_to_use: Sprinkle on salads, bake into cornbread, stir into soups, or blend into sauces
sections.nutrition: Contains 12 mg of Calcium; 392 mg of Potassium
sections.storage: Sealed in a mason jar or container with a lid

recipes.name: Esquite
ingredients: ⅓ cup of Parmesan cheese or Cotija
Chile powder or Hot Cheetos powder
preparation: Add butter to a frying pan.
Add corn kernels and cook for 5 minutes over medium heat.
Serve in cups topped with cheese, mayonnaise, and chili powder.
recipes.tips: Esquites can be eaten hot or cold, depending on preference.

sections.flavor_profile: Bland, hints of salt, can be moist and flaky
sections.how_to_use: On top of rice, tostadas, or crackers; tossed in salad or pasta
sections.nutrition: 22g of protein; 2% calcium; 4% potassium; high iron
sections.storage: Sealed in Tupperware or in a Mason jar with a lid

recipes.name: Tuna Salad
preparation: Drain tuna and add to bowl.
Chop washed tomatoes, cucumber, and onion into cubes.
Roughly chop cilantro.
Mix all ingredients together with citrus juice and salt.

recipes.name: Tuna Noodle Casserole
preparation: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Cook pasta according to package instructions.
Coat casserole dish with oil.
Combine all ingredients in the dish and bake.
recipes.tips: Can include chopped celery, white onions, and other vegetables.

recipes.name: Tuna Melts on Pepper
preparation: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Slice peppers into quarters.
Mix tuna and mayonnaise.
Combine ingredients in casserole dish and bake for 10 minutes.
Top with cheese and bake for another 3 minutes.

sections.flavor_profile: Generally spicy; can be lemony or bitter
sections.how_to_use: Sauces, salsas, pickled, dried, or in chili poppers
sections.nutrition: High in Vitamin C, B6, and A

recipes.name: Spicy Rice Casserole
ingredients: ½ hot pepper, deseeded and chopped
preparation: Scramble eggs in 1 tbsp oil; set aside.
Sauté onion, ginger, garlic, peppers, broccoli, and rice in remaining oil.
Cook until rice is crispy.
Add soy and oyster sauce mixture.
Mix eggs back in and serve.

sections.how_to_use: Deseed and slice for cooking or stuffing
sections.storage: Refrigerate in a sealed bag; can freeze for 10-12 months

recipes.name: Chili Stuffed Poblano Peppers
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Cook turkey; add chili, salt, cheese, tomatoes, and onions.
Roast oiled peppers for 5 minutes until skin blisters.
Stuff peppers with chili filling.

sections.flavor_profile: Young: carrot-like; Aged: potato-like; Old: bitter
sections.storage: Store in dry, cool, dark environment without green tops

recipes.name: Leek, Turnip, and Rice Soup
preparation: Sauté leeks and turnips until tender.
Add garlic, stock, salt, bay leaf, and rice.
Simmer covered for 30 minutes.

sections.flavor_profile: Sweet flavor similar to tomato when ripe
sections.how_to_use: Raw in salads, breads, or jams
sections.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe

recipes.name: Vegetable Hand Rolls (Temaki)
preparation: Cook rice and mix with seasoning.
Cut vegetables and persimmons into matchsticks.
Spread rice on nori, top with vegetables, and roll.

sections.flavor_profile: Bitter when raw; creamy and earthy when cooked
sections.how_to_use: Sliced, cubed, or halved for baking and curries
sections.storage: Cool place or refrigerated in a perforated bag

recipes.name: Eggplant Curry
preparation: Bake eggplants at 400°F for 30-35 minutes.
Sauté scallions, mushrooms, garlic, and chili.
Add spices and tomatoes; simmer.
Mash eggplant flesh and add to sauce; simmer 5 minutes.

sections.how_to_use: Remove arils for salads and fresh eating
sections.nutrition: Vitamin K, A, and B9 Folate
sections.storage: Cool room temperature for weeks; fridge for 2 months

recipes.name: Pear and Pomegranate Salad
ingredients: Vinaigrette: orange juice, olive oil, mustard, vinegar, poppyseeds, honey
preparation: Layer salad ingredients in a bowl.
Shake vinaigrette ingredients in a jar.
Drizzle and toss before serving.

sections.flavor_profile: Strong pungency when raw; rich when cooked
sections.storage: Dry, dark place for up to six months

recipes.name: Garlic Clove Spaghetti
preparation: Sauté garlic in oil for 40 minutes until caramelized.
Brown pork chops in the same pan.
Blend garlic with half and half to a hummus consistency.
Toss cooked pasta with butter, garlic mixture, and red pepper flakes.

recipes.name: Orzo with Garlicky Spinach
preparation: Cook orzo.
Sauté spinach and garlic in butter.
Stir in orzo, cheese, broth, and vinegar.

sections.storage: Refrigerate if ripe; room temperature if unripe

recipes.name: Roasted Tomato Avocado Toast
ingredients: Parsley, Italian seasoning, olive oil, balsamic vinegar
preparation: Roast seasoned tomato slices at 375°F for 15-20 minutes.
Mash avocado with lime juice.
Spread on toast and top with roasted tomatoes and balsamic.

sections.flavor_profile: Sharp, spicy, and zesty when raw
sections.storage: Sealed bag with damp paper towels in fridge

recipes.name: Corn Salad with Radishes, Jalapeno, and Lime
preparation: Chop radishes, jalapeno, and cilantro.
Combine all ingredients and season with salt.

recipes.name: Butternut Squash Soup
preparation: Sauté onion; add chopped vegetables and broth.
Simmer for 40 minutes.
Puree until smooth.

recipes.name: Butternut Squash Basmati Rice
preparation: Toast seeds in butter.
Add rice and squash; stir to coat.
Add water and simmer for 15 minutes.

sections.flavor_profile: Sweet when cooked; fresh when raw
sections.storage: Dark, cool, dry place (do not refrigerate)

recipes.name: Chicken, Sweet Potato, and Black Bean Skillet
preparation: Sauté chicken and onion with spices.
Add sweet potato, tomatoes, beans, and salsa.
Cook 2-3 minutes, top with cheese and melt.

sections.storage: Airtight container in cool, dark place

recipes.name: Lima Bean Soup
preparation: Combine broth, beans, and vegetables; simmer 25-35 minutes.
Stir in cream and heat through.

sections.how_to_use: Steam or boil; do not cut seed pods before cooking
sections.storage: Refrigerate in a plastic bag; use within 2-3 days

recipes.name: Okra and Chickpeas in Fresh Tomato Sauce
preparation: Sauté onion and garlic.
Add tomatoes and spices; cook until broken down.
Add okra and simmer 10 minutes.
Mix in chickpeas and parsley.

sections.storage: Sealed plastic bags in refrigerator crisper for 3-4 days

recipes.name: Sauteed Collard Greens with Mushrooms
ingredients: Spices: garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, cayenne
preparation: Sauté mushrooms and garlic until brown.
Add sliced collard greens and spices; cook covered 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes and rice; cook 3-5 minutes more.
